text: The following is a list of notable events and releases of the year 1901 in Norwegian music. ==Events== ==Deaths== ==Births== ; January * 4 – Kari Marie Aarvold Glaser, pianist and music teacher (died 1972). ; August * 16 – Olav Kielland, composer and conductor (died 1985). ; July * 7 – Erling Kjellsby, organist and composer (died 1976). ; October * 6 – Aslak Brekke, traditional folk singer (died 1978). * 8 – Eivind Groven, microtonal composer and music- theorist (died 1977). ==See also== * 1901 in Norway * Music of Norway ==References== Category:Norwegian music Norwegian Music Category:1900s in Norwegian music
title: 1901 in Norwegian music
